title: Pep Guardiola "sad" about Luis Enrique quitting as Barcelona prepare to lose their "perfect trainer"
text:

Pep Guardiola believes Luis Enrique is "perfect" for Barcelona after the Spaniard announced his exit from the club. 
Enrique confirmed he would depart at the end of the season , following his side's victory over Sporting Gijon. 
This is the 46-year-old's third season with the Catalan giants but he will not extend his stay beyond the end of the campaign. 
Guardiola is one of Enrique's predecessors with the pair teammates during their playing days at the Nou Camp. 
After his side's FA Cup win over Huddersfield, Guardiola had his say on the decision. Guardiola is greeted by Luis Enrique (Photo: Reuters / Albert Gea) Barcelona's coach Luis Enrique (Photo: Getty) 
"As a Barcelona fan, I’m sad that we’ll miss the perfect trainer for Barcelona," Guardiola said. 
"In his three years they have played unbelievable football. They are the best team in the world. 
"Thank you for all he has done in three years at my club." Guardiola saw his side thrash Huddersfield (Photo: Getty) 
Enrique confirmed his decision was due to him needing a rest with Sevilla boss Jorge Sampaoli the favourite to replace him. 
Everton boss Ronald Koeman is also in the running, as is Tottenham's Mauricio Pochettino.
